com.bazaarvoice
Class BazaarRequest

java.lang.Object
  com.bazaarvoice.BazaarRequest

public class BazaarRequest
extends java.lang.Object

Sends and handles requests to the Bazaarvoice API. Both submissions and display requests are handled by this class. They are differentiated by calling the corresponding method to send the request and by passing an object of the corresponding subclass of BazaarParams.

There are options for both display and submission using asynchronous requests, queued requests, and blocking requests.

Created on 7/9/12. Copyright (c) 2012 BazaarVoice. All rights reserved.

Author:
Bazaarvoice Engineering

Initialize the request with the necessary parameters.

Parameters:
domainName - your client domain name
passKey - your api test key
apiVersion - the version of the api you want to use

                               DisplayParams params,
                               OnBazaarResponse listener)
Send a request, spawn a thread, and return the result via the listener. (non-blocking)

Parameters:
type - the type of request
params - the parameters for the request
listener - the listener to handle the results on

queueDisplayRequest

public void queueDisplayRequest(RequestType type,
                                DisplayParams params,
                                OnBazaarResponse listener)
Add a new request to the request queue, and return the result via the listener. This will keep the order that the requests are made in. (non-blocking)

Parameters:
type - the type of request
params - the parameters for the request
listener - the listener to handle the results on

send

public JSONObject send(java.lang.String URL,
                       com.bazaarvoice.BazaarRequest.RequestMethod method,
                       com.bazaarvoice.Media mediaEntity)
                throws BazaarException
Send a blocking request to the server with a simple string url and optional byte array.

Usage:
This method is wrapped by each of the send/post/queue methods and should not be called itself unless needed.

Parameters:
URL - the url to send the request/submit to
method - display or submit
mediaEntity - a file to send to the server
Returns:
the JSON result
Throws:
BazaarException - on any JSON or communication errors

the Http client
